verses.verse: Therefore (Judg. 2:14; Ps. 78:59) the wrath of the LORD was kindled against His people, So that He abhorred ((Deut. 9:29; 32:9)) His own inheritance.
And (Judg. 2:14; (Neh. 9:27)) He gave them into the hand of the Gentiles, And those who hated them ruled over them.
Their enemies also oppressed them, And they were brought into subjection under their hand.
(Judg. 2:16; (Neh. 9:27)) Many times He delivered them; But they rebelled in their counsel, And were brought low for their iniquity.
Nevertheless He regarded their affliction, When (Judg. 3:9; 6:7; 10:10) He heard their cry;
((Lev. 26:41, 42)) And for their sake He remembered His covenant, And (Judg. 2:18) relented (Ps. 69:16) according to the multitude of His mercies.
(1 Kin. 8:50; (2 Chr. 30:9); Ezra 9:9; Neh. 1:11; Jer. 42:12) He also made them to be pitied By all those who carried them away captive.
(1 Chr. 16:35, 36) Save us, O LORD our God, And gather us from among the Gentiles, To give thanks to Your holy name, To triumph in Your praise.
(Ps. 41:13) Blessed be the LORD God of Israel From everlasting to everlasting! And let all the people say, “Amen!” Praise the LORD!
BOOK FIVE: 230 107-150Thanksgiving to the LORD for His Great Works of Deliverance Oh, (1 Chr. 16:34; Ps. 106:1; Jer. 33:11) give thanks to the LORD, for He is good! For His mercy endures forever.
Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, Whom He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy,
And (Is. 43:5, 6; Jer. 29:14; 31:8-10; (Ezek. 39:27, 28)) gathered out of the lands, From the east and from the west, From the north and from the south.
They wandered in (Num. 14:33; 32:13; (Deut. 2:7; 32:10); Josh. 5:6; 14:10) the wilderness in a desolate way; They found no city to dwell in.
Hungry and thirsty, Their soul fainted in them.
(Ps. 50:15; (Hos. 5:15)) Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, And He delivered them out of their distresses.
And He led them forth by the (Ezra 8:21; Ps. 5:8; Jer. 31:9) right way, That they might go to a city for a dwelling place.
(Ps. 107:15, 21) Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
For ((Ps. 34:10; Luke 1:53)) He satisfies the longing soul, And fills the hungry soul with goodness.
Those who ((Is. 42:7; Mic. 7:8; Luke 1:79)) sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, (Job 36:8) Bound in affliction and irons—
Because they (Lam. 3:42) rebelled against the words of God, And despised ((Ps. 73:24)) the counsel of the Most High,
Therefore He brought down their heart with labor; They fell down, and there was (Ps. 22:11) none to help.
Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, And He saved them out of their distresses.
(Ps. 68:6) He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, And broke their chains in pieces.
Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
For He has (Is. 45:1, 2) broken the gates of bronze, And cut the bars of iron in two.
Fools, ((Is. 65:6, 7; Jer. 30:14, 15); Lam. 3:39; Ezek. 24:23) because of their transgression, And because of their iniquities, were afflicted.
(Job 33:20) Their soul abhorred all manner of food, And they (Job 33:22) drew near to the gates of death.
Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, And He saved them out of their distresses.
(Matt. 8:8) He sent His word and (2 Kin. 20:5; Ps. 30:2) healed them, And (Job 33:28, 30) delivered them from their destructions.
Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
(Lev. 7:12; Ps. 50:14; Heb. 13:15) Let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, And (Ps. 9:11) declare His works with rejoicing.
Those who go down to the sea in ships, Who do business on great waters,
They see the works of the LORD, And His wonders in the deep.
For He commands and (Jon. 1:4) raises the stormy wind, Which lifts up the waves of the sea.
They mount up to the heavens, They go down again to the depths; (Ps. 22:14) Their soul melts because of trouble.
They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, And are at their wits’ end.
Then they cry out to the LORD in their trouble, And He brings them out of their distresses.
(Ps. 89:9; Matt. 8:26; Luke 8:24) He calms the storm, So that its waves are still.
Then they are glad because they are quiet; So He guides them to their desired haven.
(Ps. 107:8, 15, 21) Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
Let them exalt Him also (Ps. 22:22, 25) in the assembly of the people, And praise Him in the company of the elders.
He (1 Kin. 17:1, 7; Is. 50:2) turns rivers into a wilderness, And the watersprings into dry ground;
A (Gen. 13:10; Deut. 29:23) fruitful land into barrenness, For the wickedness of those who dwell in it.
